oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Confederate veteran William Rawleigh Campbell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William R. Campbell of Haywood County, Tenn. served as a private in Co. D, 8th Ark. Inf., CSA. and posed beside a cannon at a veterans reunion in his United Confederate Veterans uniform. Campbell fought at Shiloh, Perryville, and Murfreesboro. He was wounded at Chickamauga and at Atlanta. He lost his foot at the Battle of Franklin on November 29, 1864. Held prisoner in Nashville in a "place not decent for pigs to live in," he was transferred to Camp Chase, Ohio, later paroled at Vicksburg on June 1, 1865.
